intro: Podandrogyne roseoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fruit-like structures called drupes. Podandrogyne roseoleuca is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important part of the local flora in those regions.
